title: Battle of Franklin (1864)
summary: The Battle of Franklin was fought on November 30, 1864, in Franklin, Tennessee, as part of the Franklinâ€“Nashville Campaign of the American Civil War. It was one of the worst disasters of the war for the Confederate States Army. Confederate Lt. Gen. John Bell Hood's Army of Tennessee conducted numerous frontal assaults against fortified positions occupied by the Union forces under Maj. Gen. John Schofield and was unable to prevent Schofield from executing a planned, orderly withdrawal to Nashville.
